channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lime bikes blocking zebra cross in Middle Lane, Crouch-End, London (tonight, Saturday,10.15 pm - 17.01.26), 17th January
item.description:
I don't have the bikes numbers. I don't know where they are located on the bikes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, The Broadway, Crouch End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leakage on road, 17th January
item.description:
Water leak coming up through tarmac on Humber Road (Vanbrugh end) and flowing into the drain in the photo. There was a similar leak on the same road a week ago, at Halstow end. Suspect this was caused by the sub zero freezing conditions to water pipework.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dinsdale Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 6 street lights out again, 17th January
item.description:
6 street lights out again along Bexley Road. Starting at bus stop AM to Parish gate drive. It feels unsafe and some of these lights were only fixed in December!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bexley Road, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: No more light in billy furry way pathway from Finchley road, 17th January
item.description:
There is no light at all at night in billy furry way, coming from Finchley road. It is dangerous as access to flats are in total darkness, and we have a 4months old with a buggy and need access to Billy furry way to get to our flat. And the street is currently not safe
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Billy Fury Way, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Intersection of Arkwright and Frognal, 17th January
item.description:
Since the completion of Arkwright Road works, traffic is still being routed through Frognal to reach Finchley Road creating gridlocks every morning and evening. Non-resident through-traffic is creating dangerous congestion for children at nearby schools. Please update the network management data (one.network) to show the Arkwright diversion as closed and enforce the 'No Through Traffic' restriction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Frognal, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
